The War Cabinet-Agreed "that the existing restrictions regarding road signsand the immobilisation of vehicles and of boats on inlandwaters should be relaxed to the extent recommended by theLord President of the Council. The detailed scheme ofrelaxation, as approved by the War Cabinet, is set out inthe Annex to these Minutes.Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W.1,May A, 1943. ' Yv* Official report columns, 1094-1095. ' ANNEX.Relaxation of Ban on Signposts in Rural Areas and Requirement to -ImmobiLise Unattended Motor Vehicles and Boats on inland waterways.1. Great Britain will be divided into two zones : .Zone A.--the counties of Norfolk, Sm^olk, Sussex, Hampshire, Dorset,.Devon and Cornwall, together with those parts of the counties of Essex andKent lying outside the Metropolitan Police District.Zone B.-Scotland, Wales and the remainder of England, including those parts of the counties of Essex and Kent lying within the Metropolitan'Police District.Signposts.2. -(i) In Zone A, a complete ban on signposts will remain throughout a -20-mile coastal strip along the south coast, but in the remainder of the zone signposts Will be permitted"in built-up areas.(ii) In Zone B, signposts will be permitted in built-up areas throughouta 20-mile coastal strip along the East coast of the Zone (includingScotland), and throughout the remainder of the Zone there willbe no restrictions of any kind on the erection of signposts.(iii) Throughout the areas to which some restriction still applies ArmyCommanders will be empowered to permit the erection of sign-posts outside the terms of the above general principles, if they are requested to do so by Regional Transport Commissioners, in anycase in which they are satisfied that the presence of signposts inthe areas concerned does not prejudice military security.3. The requirement to immobilise unattended motor vehicles will remainin force throughout Zone A, but will be discontinued throughout Zone B.4. Boats on inland waterways will be immobilised in Zone A only (boatslying below the limits of estuaries and river mouths will continue to be subjectto the Vessels (Immobilisation) Orders made by the Admiralty).5. The relaxations indicated above will be subject to the condition that thefull restrictions can be reimposed at short notice.
